simplified_answer: Crypto bull markets are primarily driven by four interconnected cycles: 1) Halving-induced supply shocks (Bitcoin's block reward reductions), 2) Monetary policy liquidity (low real interest rates and expanding central bank balance sheets), 3) Technological adoption S-curves (DeFi, NFTs, scaling solutions reaching inflection points), and 4) Network effect compounding (Metcalfe's Law valuation expansions). Historical analysis shows these factors converge every 3-4 years, creating 12-18 month parabolic rallies where assets typically appreciate 10-50x from bear market lows. The current cycle is uniquely influenced by institutional custody infrastructure maturation and AI-driven productivity gains in blockchain development.

related_commander_insights.current_outlook: Confluence of Bitcoin halving (April 2024), potential Fed pivot (2025), and zk-Rollup adoption creates foundation for next bull phase
related_commander_insights.forecast: Cycle peak projected Q4 2026-Q1 2027 with BTC $250-350k and ETH $20-30k based on logarithmic regression models

further_reading.title: The Bitcoin Halving: Historical Analysis and Future Implications
